com.qtplaf.library.task

Class TaskRunnerList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.task.TaskRunner
      • com.qtplaf.library.task.TaskRunnerList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TaskRunnerList
extends TaskRunner
    A task that executes a list of tasks sequentially. Tasks are executed in a separated thread.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  TaskRunnerList.TaskAdapter
      The task listener that interacts with the task being executed.

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task task)
        Add a task to the list of tasks to be executed. The tasks must be added before any execution is started.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to be added.

      • countSteps

        public long countSteps()
        Counts the number of steps.
        Returns:
        The number of steps.

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes the underlying task processing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an unrecoverable error occurs during execution.

      • allExecutingTerminated

        private boolean allExecutingTerminated()
        Check if all executing tasks are teminated.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • checkCancel

        protected boolean checkCancel()
        Convenience method to deal with cancel requests when cancel is supported. Usage: at the begining of the main loop, if check break the loop.

        if (checkCancel()) break;

        Overrides:
        checkCancel in class TaskRunner
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that cancel has been accepted and processing should terminate.

      • checkPause

        protected boolean checkPause()
        Convinience method to deal with pause/resume requests when pause/resume is supported. Usage: at the begining of the main loop, if check continue.

        if (checkPause()) continue;

        Overrides:
        checkPause in class TaskRunner
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that pause has been accepted and processing should pause.

      • isCancelSupported

        public boolean isCancelSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support cancel requests. Event if the current executin task does not support cancel, the task list can always cancel after the current task has terminated.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isCountStepsSupported

        public boolean isCountStepsSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task supports counting steps through a call to countSteps(). The number of steps is the number of tasks to execute, so this task always supports countSteps().
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isIndeterminate

        public boolean isIndeterminate()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate, that is, the task can not count its number of steps. A task list is always determinate and the number of steps is the number of tasks to execute. This method should always return false.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate.

      • isPauseSupported

        public boolean isPauseSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support the pause/resume requests. Event if the current executin task does not support pause/resume, the task list can always pause after the current task has terminated.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<Task> getChildren()
        Returns the list of children tasks when this task is an upper level task made of aa list of tasks.
        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface Task
        Overrides:
        getChildren in class TaskRunner
        Returns:
        The list of children tasks
